title: A Fusion Model for Art Style and Author Recognition Based on Convolutional Neural Networks and Transformers
author: Zhenyu Wang (North China Electric Power University), Heng Song (North China Electric Power University), ...
relevance_why: This paper presents a novel approach to fusing Convolutional Neural Networks and Transformers for art recognition, which may inspire similar methods in audio classification tasks where feature extraction at multiple scales is required.
background: Art recognition involves classifying artworks based on styles and authors, essential for applications like cultural heritage protection and historical research.
contribution: This paper introduces a hybrid model that effectively combines local feature extraction from Convolutional Neural Networks with global context modeling of Transformers to improve classification accuracy in art recognition.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional methods and individual models (CNNs and Transformers) either focus on local features or struggle with global context modeling.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates both local and global features through a fusion mechanism, resulting in noticeable improvements in classification accuracy by 9.7% and 7.1% across two datasets.

key_innovation: The cascading fusion strategy uniquely combines the strengths of CNNs and Transformers to enhance both local detail recognition and global context understanding.
real_world_impact: The advancement in art style and author recognition could improve efficiency for museums and art galleries, as well as enhance the management of digital art collections.
limitations: The model may struggle with complex backgrounds in artworks, potentially affecting classification accuracy.

new_terms.cascading fusion: **Cascading fusion** refers to a strategy where outputs from different neural network components are integrated in stages, allowing enhanced feature representation at each step.
